name: Cowboy Bread
author: Kasienko
summary: Similar to pita breads, this is a round fried bread which supposedly traces its origins back to the great American West.
directions: In a large bowl, stir together the water, milk, and sugar
Sprinkle the yeast over the top, and let stand for 5 minutes to dissolve
Stir the egg and butter into the yeast mixture, then stir in the salt, nutmeg, and 2 cups of the flour
Mix until everything is well blended
Mix in remaining flour, 1/2 cup at a time until the dough pulls away from the side of the bowl
Turn out onto a floured surface, and knead for 10 minutes (no cheating!)
Place dough into a greased bowl, and let rise until doubled in size
Divide the dough into 8 balls, and let rest for another 20 minutes
Roll each ball out to 8 to 10 inches in diameter
Heat a cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat
Fry each of the pieces of bread fro 30 to 60 seconds on each side, or until light to medium brown spots appear
Keep covered with a damp cloth, or store in a plastic bag until serving
